thread.title: Labour MP Keir Starmer nets £10k advising Gibraltar politicians as they looked to nobble Brexit
thread.title_full: Labour MP Keir Starmer nets £10k advising Gibraltar politicians as they looked to nobble Brexit

author: dcoombs
title: Labour MP Keir Starmer nets £10k advising Gibraltar politicians as they looked to nobble Brexit
text:
REMOANER'S QUIDS IN Labour MP Keir Starmer nets £10k advising Gibraltar politicians as they looked to nobble Brexit 
Labour MP has declared earning almost £10,000 for giving legal advice to Gibraltar as territory campaigned against Brexit Exclusive Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LABOUR Remoaner Sir Keir Starmer was paid almost £10,000 by Gibraltar for “legal advice” as it tried to nobble Brexit. 
The former Director of Public Prosecutions got £9,480 for just 20 hours of work in December 2015, according to the MPs’ Register of Interests. Reuters 3 Nice earner… Keir Starmer received £9,480 for 20 hours work 
It came just days before Gibraltar’s politicians published draft legislation to enable its pro-EU citizens to vote in the referendum. 
The British Overseas Territory relies on around 12,000 Spanish workers — half its ­workforce — crossing the border every day. Getty Images 3 British: The Rock of Gibraltar 
Its population voted 96 per cent in favour of remaining in the EU, making it the most pro-European part of Britain. Related Stories NO BLANK CHEQUE Labour will seek to amend Article 50 bill if Theresa May fails to put forward a Brexit plan JUDGE DREAD Hated European judges will STILL rule over us even after we leave EU under barmy Labour plans ROCK SOLID Gibraltar willing to 'pay any price' of Brexit to escape Spain, Chief Minister Fabian Picardo declares KEEP OFF OUR LAND! British warships should be sent to Gibraltar 'to protect it from Spain' during Brexit negotiations SHIFTING BLAME Labour's bigwig who started witch hunt against Sun journalists refuses to apologise despite acquittals 
Starmer — Shadow Secretary of State for Exiting the European Union — refused to reveal the nature of his legal advice to the Gibraltar government, but insisted it had nothing to do with helping them draft their legislation. 
The lawyer, who has a £1.5million London pad and family home in Surrey, said: “As you know, legal advice is confidential and privileged.” Times Newspapers Ltd
